remarks: The predicate "is a prime number".  A prime number is an integer greater than or equal to 2 whose only positive divisors are 1 and itself. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 26-Oct-2012.)
statement:
isprm2 $p |- ( P e. Prime <-> ( P e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) /\ A. z e. NN ( z || P -> ( z = 1 \/ z = P ) ) ) ) $.
$d P z $.
